channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Democrats Commemorate Jan. 6, Highlighting Trump’s Role
item.description: On Capitol Hill, Democrats spent the fifth anniversary of the riot forcefully rebutting the president’s attempts to rewrite the history of the attack,...

item.title: Swiss Bar Hit by Deadly Fire Was Not Inspected for 6 Years, Authorities Say
item.description: Officials in Crans-Montana, the Swiss alpine resort town where a bar fire killed 40 people last week, are facing growing accusations of lax oversight.

item.title: Attempting to predict the economy in 2026
item.description: Economists may have a pretty dismal record with predictions. But we're still interested in what they see in their non-existent crystal balls.

item.title: How Venezuela’s Oil Could Shake Up the World Supply
item.description: The country could, eventually, attract investment and re-emerge as a force in the oil markets, but many analysts are concerned about an oversupply.

item.title: Hungarian filmmaker Béla Tarr — known for bleak, existential movies — has died
item.description: Tarr's films were long, dark, and often abstract explorations of everyday life and politics.

item.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene's puzzling political transformation, explained
item.description: Once a fierce advocate for Trump and his MAGA base, Greene has broken with the president and resigned from Congress. New Yorker writer Charles Bethea ...

item.title: The Judge in the Maduro Case Must Step Aside
item.description: There is no simple procedural mechanism for lawyers, or the public, to challenge the fitness of judges.

item.title: Edith Renfrow Smith, pioneer and witness to history, dies at 111
item.description: Last year, for Black History Month, NPR's Scott Simon spoke with Edith Renfrow Smith of Chicago, who has died at 111 years old.

item.title: Lawmakers split over Maduro's seizure. And, CDC cuts childhood vaccine schedule
item.description: Ousted Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro and his wife pleaded not guilty in New York yesterday. And, the CDC scales back routine childhood vaccine reco...

item.title: Trump Warns of Impeachment if Republicans Lose Midterm Elections
item.description: President Trump is still sowing doubt about the integrity of America’s elections. The claims could affect this year’s midterms.

item.title: Live Updates: Venezuela Projects Unity as Trump’s Threats Cause Jitters Around the World
item.description: Venezuela’s attorney general urged steadfastness in the face of U.S. “state terrorism.” After President Trump’s renewed threats on Greenland, some Eur...

item.title: The Unanswered Questions About Venezuela’s Environmental Future
item.description: The Trump administration has made no secret that it covets Venezuela’s oil reserves. What happens next could have serious implications for the planet.

item.title: Swiss Bar Hit by Deadly Fire Was Not Inspected for 6 Years, Authorities Say
item.description: Officials in Crans-Montana, the Swiss alpine resort town where a bar fire killed 40 people last week, are facing growing accusations of lax oversight.

item.title: Europe Rallies for Greenland as Trump’s Threats Continue
item.description: The show of solidarity comes as President Trump, emboldened by his capture of Nicolás Maduro from Venezuela, has suggested he could take action agains...

item.title: Winter Weather Snarls Travel Across Northern Europe
item.description: Ice and cold disrupted airports and caused car accidents on Tuesday. More snow is expected in Amsterdam and Brussels on Wednesday.
